Job Title: Director Photo Recognition Program

Location: Charlotte, NC

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Art/Creative, Design, Information Technology

Description:
Requisition ID: 188446

Posting Locations: Charlotte

Click here to view a Day in the Life of our Teammates!

Our Secret Ingredient is our Teammates. 

We offer great rewards , competitive pay , career advancement and growth opportunities .

Full Time Teammates are also eligible for:

 Paid Training  Paid Time Off plus paid holidays  401(k) with Company matching on a dollar-for-dollar basis  Employee Stock Purchase Plan (ESPP)  Group Health Insurance – Medical, Dental, Vision & Disability  Basic and Supplemental Life Insurance 


Refresh and Grow your Career with Us!

Job Overview

The purpose of this job is to the ability to use an emerging technology, to lead a team, to capture 100% accurate data of outlet execution (includes asset placements, inventory, planogram adherence, pricing to name few). In addition, it includes capturing inventory positions to influence ordering and ordering algorithms. Develop and execute effective training and sustainability programs. Simultaneously implement known use cases, provide a point of view on future use cases. Solve gaps in data execution and technology. Build processes with direct reports that deliver consistent results. Design processes to address one off use cases, and collaborate with other departments to solve dispatching of the reset team and other avenues to capture photos. Due to the multiple channels of business served, some areas of related opportunity are less evident than others so this leader will help us maximize the value of the technology in all areas of the business.

Duties & Responsibilities

Determines and leads the integration of this emerging technology into our total enterprise go-to-market strategies, impacting all channels of business. Strategies will support data-based enhancements to the design, selling, and execution tracking of our Commercial Plans. Will need to understand proper phasing and infrastructure capabilities to advocate and influence for enhancements needed to future-proof our go-to-market approach with AI technology. Coordinates with frontline team management to design and execute field training and sustaining programs to ensure tools are effectively adopted and supported.Problem solves for gaps in deployment process, technological capabilities, and change management initiatives. Agile mindset to understand re-prioritization and replanning. Will establish strategy KPIs with cross-functional partners, then monitor for performance gaps to adjust accordingly. Executive presence and comfortability with senior-level audiences. Will represent quantitative results and technical outcomes before a diverse stakeholder audience.Inspire and effectively lead a team. Will need to evaluate resources and team structure needs over time.Work with cross functional teammates to deliver actionable and consumable insights that are relevant to shared scorecards that support total enterprise execution, financial, customer, and commercial targets.Develop processes with direct reports to enable consistent results 


Knowledge, Skills, & Abilities

Strong technical and problem-solving skillsUnderstanding of situational field behaviorAble to communicate appropriately to multiple levels of the organizationChange Management experiencePeople management experienceInfluence without authority skills neededAbility to drive multiple high visibility projects concurrently


Minimum Qualifications

Bachelor’s degreeKnowledge acquired through 3 to up to 5 years of relevant work experienceValid Driver's License needed 


Preferred Qualifications

Concentration in Business AdministrationPreferred photo recognition experience or exposure in addition to Consumer Package Goods industry knowledge 


Work Environment

Office Environment

Travel will be on an "as needed" basis, and will vary by initiative.

This position will be based out of Charlotte, NC.

Coca-Cola Consolidated, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or status as a protected veteran.

Experience Level (if available): Director
